name: adolescently
content:

in a way that is typical of a young person who is developing into an adult: He still suffered from an adolescently painful shyness. I found her adolescently confrontational way of responding to even the simplest of requests very tiring.
More examplesFewer examplesHe still clings on to some adolescently black-and-white political opinions.My adolescently abrupt "Just because" reply was not well received by the teacher.There was something adolescently awkward about her in the way she held herself and spoke to people.
